alert.note: Alert for La Sal and Abajo Mountains; Tavaputs Plateau (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 19 at 2:40PM MST until February 22 at 11:00PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches possible. Wind gusts of 55 to 70 mph will be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwest, southwest and west central Colorado and east central and southeast Utah. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially on ridge tops and mountain passes. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind gusts over 60 mph could occur mainly above 10000 feet early Wednesday morning through the afternoon hours.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: La Sal and Abajo Mountains; Tavaputs Plateau
